title: Ticket #910: Master hard to kill during restart
description:
If the master fails to re-exec itself, it sits in a loop sleeping between retries, never returning to daemon-core. This makes it impossible to kill it with anything sort of a kill -9. A condor_off -master or kill -15 should be able to make it exit.

During an upgrade of the UW-CS pool, the wrapper script around condor_master went missing on a few machines. The master sat in a loop occasionally trying to exec the missing file. The CSL tried stopping Condor with the init script and a kill -15, both of which had no effect.
